name: Montgomery Waylon
text: Brought a 2000 Camero from here on March the 1st which was a Friday. I brought the car back in on Monday the 4th and told them the service engine light came on and something under the car was rattling. I was told by the owners son that he didnt know anything about standard shift cars and they would not be responsible for anything wrong with it. Almost 3 weeks later the car starts running hot. When my husband got to me to check it out he opened up the radiator to find that it is full of J.B block seal he runs over 80 gallons of water through the radiator trying to clean it out to no avail. We replaced the thermostat that was so coroded with block seal it was rusted up. I called and left a message with Pierce auto sales telling them that the car was running hot and because someone was trying to cover up a cracked block or blown head gasket and there was so much block seal in the radiator and engine that I didn't know if the car was going to make it home and that I really needed someone to call me back because I had no way to get it home. I never recieved a call back.It cost me $60 to rent a car dolly to drag it home. Now the car came with an outside warranty but because "whoever" filled the motor up with block seal to hide a major problem until they could find an idiot "me" to take the car off of there hands the warranty will not cover the car. So now I have a blown up car sitting in my yard that I drove less then a month and repo men knocking on my door because they want there car back and still after all this time I have yet to recieve a call from anyone at Pierce Auto Sales.  I recieved more help and sympathy from the repo man in 10 minutes then I have from Pierce in 2 months. I paid $1500 down for a car that didn't even last until the first payment was due. I dont bash people or businesses but i have tried every other way to get them to talk to me. I just want my money back so I can get a car that runs and won't leave me on the side of the road less then a month after purchase.

Offered to buy truck and send nonrefundable deposit and got the runaround.

I've bought multiple vehicles from out of state and a $500 deposit tends to get cooperation  from more reputable dealers.

I then offered to have my bank wire the funds or overnight the check and they wouldn't go for that; keep in mind this was Dec 23rd so getting my credit union to fund same day without wiring instructions for an out of state transaction would not be possible.

Was offered the truck if I could get there, 4 hours away, with full cash payment.

Later that day they raised the price 10%, sounds like the owner messed up on his pricing and wanted to find any way to not honor the price he initially offered me.

After reading these other reviews I think it was for the better.

name: Alec Hadley
text:
On September 10, 2020, my car broke down right outside Chatom AL. I sent my car that was under warranty to Chatom Ford. That was one of my worst mistakes possible. The first week of their service was promising. After that it was all down hill. Shade the “Service Manager” was my main point of contact. He would promise me updates and call backs which I would never get a returning call. On October 16th I was PROMISED my car was repaired and ready for pick up. As I had two friends take off work to take me 5.5 hours to Chatom Ford, Shade called me and said “the car jumped time and is not ready”. The following day I called to get the new date  I could expect my car to be repaired.  Shade then tells me that he had been lying to me and my car was not ready and he does not know why my car is not fixed nor when it could be fixed. During this call he also promised me that the car would be sent to my house in Tennessee. After Shade continued to lie about my car and repairing it, I then moved to speaking with Collin Ward (General Manager)-  I only spoke with him once because he told me “ I’m sure what you are saying MAY have happened, but im sure my team has a better way of going about this story”. He also promised I would get a call back from him and I never did. Collin also asked me why I would even send my car here with it being out of state and not send it local (I was on my way back from vacation on the coast when it happened). In my opinion, this should not matter. With no hope, I called asking for the owner, Gene Brown. No one would help me reach him. Then I finally received a call from Kevin O’Brien. He was very promising and reassuring at first as they all were. Kevin worked with my father and I for about two weeks then he stated to not take our calls or call us back as promised. Last, my father began to work with Lara. She was helpful in helping us know what was going on. She is who we worked with for the rest of this mayhem. 99 days later on December 18th Chatom Ford met me in Mississippi to give me my car. This dealership is an ACTUAL JOKE. From day one I asked for nothing but updates and I never once got that. NOT ONE WORKER AT THIS PLACE (I say place because I can not call this a business because this place has no business structure at all.) was truthful in customer service to my father or myself. If anyone at this place has any further questions feel free to contact me as you have my name and number. PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY AND TIME BY NOT SENDING YOUR CAR HERE. THIS MANAGEMENT IS A JOKE AND ABSOLUTELY WORTHLESS IN THEIR PROFESSION.
Thank you for the worst Ford experience I could ever ask for. You really make a name for yourself.

name: Breanne Kinney
text:
Our experience with Jim Cook Ford was nothing short of first-class. I’ll start with the fact that I hate shopping for new vehicles. It takes too much time and so many people try applying way too much pressure.

Anyways, Jim Cook Ford had a vehicle in stock that I wanted to test drive. I called them after work one day to find out if it was still available and arrange a test drive. I spoke with Brock and he told me that I could stop by anytime for a test drive. I warned him I only wanted to test drive and had no plans on walking away with the vehicle that day. He encouraged me to come by when I was ready.

When I showed up at the dealership he had the vehicle ready to go and threw me the keys. After the test drive, Brock answered a bunch more questions and was straight forward when I asked him something he didn’t know. Never once did he try to make up answers to anything he didn’t know.

The price and customer service was great so I had a lot to think about as I walked away that day. Anyways, I took a day off work later in the week and traveled a bit further to a larger city to see what kind of deal I could get. Let me tell you that trip ended poorly. I was so disgusted at getting treated as just another number. The place didn’t care about my name or me. They just wanted to know what I wanted for a monthly payment. Even worse was the fact that the dealership was trying to pass off a beat up vehicle as nearly new.

Once I was convinced the vehicle Jim Cook Ford had was the one for me, I called Brock. He told me it was still on the lot. I arranged another visit and was literally “sold.” Brock did such a fantastic job at never pressuring the sale. He treated me as a person who had options. I could never say enough good things about the dealership. Even after the sale I heard from Brock a couple of times following up on my satisfaction. What more could a person ask for?

text:
Steer clear of this car lot! They sold us a car that they knew was for our 16 yr old daughter. We made it home and the next day the car would not shift into gear and then completely died. The owner did take our call and told us it was because a ground wire caused the transmission to stop working. We got the car to a local mechanic we use for everything who tested the car and said there are major electrical issues and multiple transmission codes. They knew this car was a lemon when the sold it to us. I get that used cars are a gamble but not the kind of issues this vehicle has. It's not even worth fixing. TRUST Me there is a reason their cars are priced so cheap. I'm sure not every car the sell is bad but they do sale junk cars/lemons.

BEWARE, Save your money.  You get what you pay for.

text: Good experience will go back for another car. Very helpful on getting me into the right vehicle with the down payment I had. People are super nice. Will recommend to all family and friends.

name: Evan Lewis
text:
Recently bought a car from them. Car seems like it’s a great vehicle and for a reasonable price.

The only problem I had is that we made a deal with them to replace the battery in the car (which was a hybrid) and they gave us a battery that wasn’t for a hybrid. I went back and what should have been a calm discussion about getting the right battery turned into a very heated exchange when the dealer began to call my mother rude and claiming the battery was fine.

The battery ( the 12 V startup one) is a specialty type of battery for a hybrid that only the dealer provides and costs about 500$:

We ended up getting a check from them to get the battery from the dealer (they wouldn’t pay the install price, just the wholesale). The thing is, is that this review would have been 5 stars if they had just been polite and understating when we came to them about the problem. We could have gotten to the same point without the very unpleasant arguing and lying. That had us coming away with what seems to be a great car but a really bad taste in our mouth about the dealer.

Hope the car runs for a long time, but when buying a car from here .... MAKE SURE you get any agreement in writing (be very specific) and check with an inspection place they have done the work correctly  before sigining the dotted line.

name: Mary Lavicka
text: Not the type to generally leave a review, but Im doing so in this case since we felt very strongly about  the people we dealt with. Great, genuine people here. Drove an hour and a half to the location, test drove the 2014 Nissan and took it to get checked out at a near by garage. It checked out- As any used car it had minor things that needed to be addressed but that's to be expected with any used car. I don't expect a brand new car, besides a mechanic shop HAS to give you a long list otherwise they feel like they have not done their job correctly. Came back, negotiated price (which was already low and I admit to that since I did my research). The gentleman was polite and told me he could knock of $200. Paid it in cash and made it through the paperwork hassle free in less than 15 minutes. On the way out I ran into  the owner who  explained to me the way that they conducted their business. They seemed to do well and sold many cars at that location. He was a very down to earth person. The reason for my detailed explanation is to make it clear to anyone that looks at online reviews to take them for a grain of salt. Mid-conversation with the owner I watched a man come into this dealership and demand new brakes and tires on a vehicle he bought a few weeks back apparently, and otherwise threatened to leave a bad review!! People like that get on my last nerve. These folks are selling good quality cars for a fraction of the price. If someone wants a brand new car they need to help themselves to a brand new car store. We don't see shops like this anymore, everything is being bought out and turned into a franchise sore where you would pay at a lot more for the exact same car. We need to value these people.  Anyways it made me angry seeing someone act in such a way. These people treated us very well. We will be back to see you guys.

name: Mirandal Kendricks
text:
While I don't usually leave reviews for places I visit, I was strongly compelled to inform the people of Alabama about my visit and the "OWNER" of this establishment. If I could leave 0 stars, I would.

My mother purchased a car a few weeks ago and today she decided to go on her lunch break and get her tag. Information that should've been provided during her purchase at the dealership was requested from the clerk at the tag/title office. She placed a call and got the owner on the phone and he was attemping to assist her. While he was able to eventually get her the information she needed the process of how she had to get the information from the owner was where she had an issue. She stated that there was a language barrier which she didn't personally mind BUT as she was on her lunch break and had limited time to talk she requested to speak with someone with better English that could accomodate her and articulate the information she needed in a timely manner. The owner became rude with her during her phonecall even prompting the clerk at the window to comment on his rudeness.

I later accompanied her to his dealership as she needed to make a payment on her vehicle as well. Once arriving conveniently the owner was sitting on the front "porch" of the lot. When she expressed to him her issue with the process that it took to get information from him earlier and why she requested to speak with someone with better English he became rude with her again, and constantly interrupted her.  I happened to accompany her on this visit and made a comment about his direct rudeness. I guess he didn't take our visit too well because we'd interrupted his flirting with his employee but he then proceeded to invite the both of us into his office and present to us a dusty old box containing his many "degrees" which from what I saw were merely laminated certificates as if that gave him the right to conduct business and talk to us the way he did. I made the comment that both myself and my mother carried actual degrees from accredited universities, she even having her Masters which at the end of the day should not matter. Him having the title of "OWNER" and his many "degrees" should never give him the right to believe that he should be able to be rude to customers or anyone else for that matter. It takes way more than walking around and merely calling yourself a business owner. Its a matter of action as well. As an owner you should be able to take criticism and responsibility for your actions. A simple apology would've been good enough but my mother didn't even get that. I myself began to get upset because of the way he chose to speak to my mother. I simply could not allow it. I began to explain her position yet he attempted ot interrupt me like he did her. I wasn't allowing that either. Our conversation ended up being a mix of words in which he eventually summoned one of his employees into the room for reasons I still don't know. She attempted to explain that the owner was alone by himself at 8 AM until she was able to get into the office and the fact that she hadn't been able to hang up her purse because he asked her to take the phone. This made no difference to me or my mother because 1. She called around 1 PM not 8 AM & 2. As a business "OWNER" he should've done a better job with tailoring his business to order to fit the needs of customers. If you had staffing issues then as an "OWNER" it was on him to take on that matter himself. Either way it should not fall on the shoulders of the customer to deal with your rudeness and lack of customer service. My mother always raised me to be honest and to speak my mind so here I am speaking my mind and saying that the "OWNER" of this establishment is trash and should better spend his days gaining proper accreditation on what it means to be a good business owner and how to deliver good customer service as well taking some time to fix up his dealership because all it takes is for the wrong person to have an accident on that janky "staircase" on his lot and his entire business under fire due to lawsuit.

text: I put $1200 down on my car and paid my car note on time. After my first car note, my car broke down. I only had my car a month and a week. I was already having to buy parts for the car when I first got it as well as pay for labor. The car needs a transmission and all 4 control arms. This is the worst car dealership I have ever delt with. I told them if they would buy the parts & I pay for the labor or the other way around that I would do that and they wouldn't. They want me to pay for the parts, labor and my car note. That don't work with me. They are crooked and their cars are lemons. I advise everyone to go to another dealership. They're nice when you're looking and rude after you get it. They look out for who they want to look out for. They did my sister and cousin the same way. STAY AWAY!!!!

name: J Live Overdrive
text:
Run! Run away from this place immediately.  I called to ask about a car. I was told it was there....I called again to check their hours and ask about that car and another.  I was assured they were there.  I said it will take me 45 mins to get there...they said they would be ready for me.  Rick was the guy I spoke to.  I arrive and it's sketchy ....lots of cars with damage and flat tires...Rick greeted me and I said hey I was here to see the Mercedes-Benz C Class
...he says, Oh the black one? We just sold that last night...I said, I called you twice today before I came..he said well we got this gray one...both front tires flat on the ground, he said...they just need some air...I said nah let's look at the Hyundai, Rick says, it's right here...points to a really damaged vechicle...says let me get the key..and runs off...another man in a cart come by and hands me the key and I get in and the overhead visor was down in my view so I pushed it up to the roof...it fell right back down...again I tried...again, it fell down...I put the key in the ignition and turned it....nothing...the battery was dead...I looked at the guy and he said "oh you wanted to crank it"....I said well yeah, how else can we test drive..he said, well we don't crank these cars a lot and some have been sitting for awhile...just needs a jump real quick....I said no, I'm going to take my money and leave...what a sketchy place.  If you buy something here it had better be your last hope for anything cause you will not be happy...they straight lied to me
..caused me to drive 45 mins for trash.  I had cash in my pocket ready to buy.  Glad I trusted my gut and left....they wanted 3k for that lemon....I picked up something waaaay nicer at a real car dealership, paid cash and rolled out happy...Do Not Buy From Them!!!

text: This place is a joke. My sister went here because she found a car that she wanted.  When we pulled up I had second thoughts because the place was a dump.  There were cars on the lot with flat tires, cars with broken window panes, cars wrapped in plastic, and she asked to use the restroom and the inside of the place was nasty.  She went on and purchased the car and the damn thing put us down less than 10 miles from the place.  She called the sales person and he came with an attitude and of course he claimed it was just out of gas.  Of course they didn't want to refund her money, but a few days later they did and withheld 200 of her down payment.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.

text: Received a great deal on our 2020 Ford EcoSport.  We were able to do everything online!  Appreciate help from Shelby Parker, Dohnovan Wilcox and Edward Pyle for all the help in making our experience great.  Highly recommend this dealership!

name: Brenda Evans
text: I always come to Stivers Ford downtown to have my car serviced. The service is quick, and my service manager, Tim, is always pleasant. He is very professional, knowledgeable, and goes out of his way to make sure my vehicle needs are met. I highly recommend Tim and Stivers Ford downtown for any vehicle.

name: Hannah Todd
text: Jessica was great in making sure I knew what was going on with my car and well taken care of. I received service over two days and both days I was treated exceptionally well by all the staff and everyone was super helpful. By the second day some of the staff even remembered me/my name and made it a point to talk to me. I really appreciated the determination of the service team to find out what was wrong with my car and fix it accordingly. I'm from out of state so it was so wonderful to feel at ease with getting my car fixed. I wish I was from the area so I could go here regularly!

name: Joshua Pleasants
text: After going to many dealerships and being humiliated, I found myself here. I worked with Karley and she was literally the NICEST person I have ever met. She didn't haggle me. She didn't force me to do anything. And best of all, I felt as if I was part of the Adamson family. Everyone here was very nice and made me feel at home. From beginning to end, I was satisfied with the customer service. They were willing to go out of their way to ensure that I got what was best for me. If you're looking for any car, come here and talk to them and they will treat you as part of the family!

name: Brian Brocato
text: Quick service. Jessica kept me informed throughout the repairs. I will go there in the future if needed.

name: Lady S.
text: Mark was awesome, he made me feel like I was his top priority! And I really appreciate that! And all of the other staff members I encountered were very nice and sweet as well. I would bring my car back for future services. Thanks guys!

name: James Younger
text: Stivers Ford of Birmingham had the exact vehicle I was looking for, I had been looking for about a week for me a GT Mustang. Eugene Jones was the Salesman that helped us out with locating, prepping and fueling our ride up. He was more than helpful, he made us feel like family. Then we moved on to the financing department where Shelby Parker took care of our loan for the vehicle. He went out of his way to find us the lowest apr, and set us up with a service plan to cover everything for the next six years. I would highly recommend this dealership to anyone looking for a new vehicle, I drove five hours to get mine and would do it again.

name: Lance Huffstutler
text:
This place is unlike many dealerships in the area. The sales manager and sales people are genuinely great. Avery Blackall, in particular, was a great guy to work with when trying to find a new car. He found a car that met my price point, however, I wanted something similar to what I was currently driving and not go down in the value I perceived. He was part counselor, stress reliever and provided a very optimistic view to car buying. The manager was extremely fair in my trade in, something I haven’t been able to find with other dealerships. Usually dealerships ding you for everyone imperfection, but they gave me a fair trade in value and even helped by a few thousand to try to get this sale done.

I got a call a few days later, and Avery got me back in. It still was not my price point but met a lot of my needs in a vehicle. They also gave me an extremely generous offer on my trade in and got me an excellent deal. Overall, I think out of the four cars I’ve purchased, this has got to take the best experience I’ve had. I think the sales guy and the manager made this the best experience.

name: Erick
text: Ed at Stivers Ford made my experience delightful. He was helpful, knowledgeable, professional and knowledgeable. I will most definitely bring my car back. Thanks Ed!

name: Carol Lowry
text: My brother and I had a very pleasant experience purchasing a car at Stivers Ford, Birmingham yesterday.  Cody Banks was very helpful and a pleasure to do business with.  We feel like we were treated with respect and we were able to purchase a car that will suit my brother's needs.  Overall it was an enjoyable experience and everyone was very helpful and nice.

name: Shanita White
text: My experience at Stivers Ford was great! Everyone in the service department was very helpful especially Jessica at the front desk. She made sure I was updated on any problems with my car from the time I dropped off my car until the services was completed. I will definitely come back in the future.

name: Braden Smith
text: I worked with Ashley Andrews when picking out my most recent vehicle. Ashley was very friendly, courteous, and attentive. Would consider buying with Stivers Ford in the future. The price I paid was competitive to other dealerships in the area.

name: Greg Gibbons
text: Had a mechanical malfunction on my F-150 while on a trip.  Service I received at Stivers Ford, particularly from service advisor (Mark), was outstanding.  Got me in promptly, diagnosed and repaired the problem, and back on the road in about 4 hours.  Truck running fine since so diagnosis/repair seems accurate.  My thanks to everyone.

name: Tony Rucker
text: Got a great deal from Sparky on April 2, 2021 on a 2020 Ford Fusion Titanium. Very pleased with the helpful and cordial staff. Kudos to Sparky Sparks,  Shelby Parker and the Gen. Sales Mgr., Edward Pyle. We hope to do business again!

name: Chris Parker
text: We used Stivers Birmingham location and had Darrius Conner as our salesman. And after going to 2 other dealerships, Darius was able to get me in my new Bronco! Couldn’t have had a better experience and will definitely be using them for any car needs in the future.

name: H Stallworth
text: The service was great. Jessica the person at the service desk was great.She was very helpful and knew lots about my car maintenance. The only thing the price was much more than I expected. I have been going there for years when it was Adamson Ford.  I will definitely continue to go for all my service needs.

name: Angie
text: The service at Stiver’s Ford was amazing and efficient. I had my car fixed and repaired in a short amount of time. Mark, my service advisor, kept me informed almost daily with information about my car and the repairs. They did a really great job and it was reasonably priced for what I had to have fixed. I will definitely go back in the future for my car maintenance and any repairs.

name: Shavonne Askew
text: Mr. Eugene Jones was so wonderful to work with. He was really thorough with my vehicle of interest and I left with my desired choice. Thank you!

Mr. Mark was helpful, knowledgeable and prompt in getting my oil service done in time. I liked the part where another advisor tested the car’s battery right in front of me and even provided a printed report copy informing me that it was part of their precheck and from
that report I shouldn’t be having any issues anytime soon. Awesome folks out there.

text: Purchased vehicle online - Communications was good throughout. Saved me a 7 hour round trip. Did paperwork at home when they delivered and they took the trade in with them. A follow up a few weeks after the sale would have been a bonus. Delivery driver was also very polite !

text: I was helped immensely by service advisor Tim, who made certain I understood what was happening and would be happening with my vehicle.  Most importantly he returns my phone calls with the information I have requested.  Thanks Tim

Even though I didn't purchase the vehicle from them, Gerald in the service department was quick to attend to my needs and also took care of some other items that I was not even aware of.  Because parts had to be ordered and my vehicle had to spend a few nights with them, Gerald offered me a brand new Explorer to test drive so I had a means of transportation.  As a result of this excellent customer service, my next Ford will be purchased from Stivers.

name: spencer fortney
text: Ed in the service department was great! He explained and kept me informed on everything that was going on. Overall was highly satisfied with both the customer service and the work that was done on my truck. Will be using them in the future.

name: Allison Cervantes
text:
UPDATE: Now I CAN say something about the dealership...They say they'll contact you, but they never will. They really don't care.

Can’t really say anything about the dealership itself but a huge word of caution to avoid Sparky Sparks. He’ll promise things he can’t actually do and waste your time.
Called at 8:45am saying I was interested in purchasing a vehicle that same day and he was aware I was coming from Metro Atlanta. Thought he was being super helpful because he even texted me through personal phone. I called him not even an hour later to double check if the vehicle was actually available and about different payment options so that I would come prepared. He answered that he’d keep the keys in his pocket and made sure the vehicle was put aside not to be sold. Kept in touch the rest of the day and he asked me for my eta, let him know I was an hour away and he responded with “cool!”. I arrive to the dealership and walk in to speak to him and he is still being kind and telling me he was going to finish up with other customers and to wait outside. When he finally gets to me he has the audacity to tell me if there’s another vehicle I’d like to purchase saying he can give me the biggest discount of my life because he just sold the one I was interested in 30 minutes ago. Please ask for a different salesman that won’t lie to you!!!

resp.text: GSM Ed Pyle will reach out to you to discuss your visit and concerns.

text: Having a firm reservation to get my vehicle serviced saves me time. I especially like it when I get there and Mark, my service writer knows my name. He and others on the staff recognize me as a loyal customer. While my vehicle is serviced, I sit in Stivers' clean waiting room and read a book. Stivers personnel always greet us as they  walk through the room. Finally, checkout is fast and easy and my vehicle is waiting for me. I love my Ford Escape Titanium and the service at Stivers Ford.

text: Amazing experience at Stivers! They had me in n out with a truck I’ve always wanted. Avery Blackall did an outstanding job and I’ll definitely recommend this dealership to my friends 🤘🏼

name: Alex Gibson
text:
My first Google review. Wish I could give them 5 stars because that would mean I had a great experience. But buyers BEWARE of the management here. If you buy a used car or happen to get a lemon, you may be in for a huge headache. I bought a used vehicle on Friday, 2/19, and on Monday 2/22 I already had it being looked at by my mechanic. This was AFTER I tried to get management to respond. Vehicle's fuel pump wasn't working, and Stivers said DO NOT tow it to our place because we don't work on Rams. My mechanic found out that the fuse box had been heavily rigged to send extra juice to a failing fuel pump, just enough to get it to run. He said that this was easy to spot once they looked at it, meaning that Stivers doesn't check out the vehicles well enough. I have tried, repeatedly, to get them to return my call and talk to me about the issue, hoping they will at least acknowledge it. And additional $2000 later I've got the van back, but NO thanks to Stivers. My mechanic, on the other hand, is going to get the SECOND Google review I've ever written, and it will be 5 stars.

As of the date of this review, we are just a month past the date I bought the van, and I still have not heard from them. This was after my salesperson and the manager BOTH said he would get back in touch with me. They have three different phone numbers, and not a single message or call has been made. I will keep trying, and I hope that someone in their marketing group will see this and get back with me. I'm hoping there has been some minor miscommunication there and that I will get some assistance and help covering the expenses soon. If that happens, I'll be happy to re-evaluate my rating.

text: Very friendly and quick service! Everyone I spoke with was exceptionally nice and very helpful! It was my first visit but not my last!

text: Had a very good experience at Stivers Ford for a service visit. This was my first visit since buying a new Ford Fusion there. I went to get an oil change, but found out I could get what they call "The Works" for a full checkup of my car. The service advisor, Edward Jeszka, was very friendly and helpful in explaining what all they would do. I had made an appointment online on their site which was very easy and convenient. I got there at my appointment time and Edward greeted me, and they went right to work on my car. Even with all they did I was only there a bit over an hour. Very satisfied and looking forward to letting them do my service. Another perk is that I had earned points for buying a new car there so all this was done with points and cost me nothing.  Check them out (formerly Adamson Ford) if you are in the market for a car.

name: James Nelson
text: I had the worst experience I have ever had trying to buy a vehicle here.  I drove 2 hours to the dealership to look at a used van.  When I arrived I noticed that the van had a rear liftgate which prohibits the installation of the ladder rack I was going to add to it.  I told them it wouldn’t work for me, then inquired about a new van.  We couldn’t find it so my salesperson said let me check on this.  A few minutes later he came back and said it was at a lot a few blocks away.  He asked me to wait amd said he would go get it. I agreed.  Thirty minutes later I was still waiting.  I called my salesperson to see what was going on and got no answer. I finally left to start the 2 hour drive back home.  I texted him and told him I was leaving.  He said he found the van and would send pictures.  Frustrated at this point, I thought I can see pictures online but whatever.  This was on a Monday.  Finally, on Saturday I agreed to the terms of purchase.  They asked when I could come down and sign the papers and I asked them to email them and I would sign them electronically.  The manager didn’t know if they were setup to do that yet but would check and let me know.  (Another reviewer on here said they did their hole deal online!) I didn’t hear back from him so I reached out on Monday and asked for a proposal with the final terms.  I got that email and did not hear back from them again. I reached out to them on Friday and was told they were trying to figure out how to get me the paper work.  I didn’t hear back so Saturday evening I told the manager that I wasn’t going to purchase the van.  So far, I haven’t gotten a reply.  We had a deal, the financing was approved and yet it seems they were not interested in finishing the deal.  I have never experienced such at any other dealership.  I spent three years in automotive sales, when someone said we’ve got a deal we were always quick to get them signed sealed and delivered.  I’m still stunned by this outcome.  I would recommend you go to Long Lewis where you will find a much more pleasant car buying experience.

text: This dealership is definitely good, has great people but management wise no. So for as Ed (The sales Manager, Lydia (training coordinator I’m guessing) And Daniel Flatt (General sales manger) so I was offered a position for Stivers Ford of Birmingham and started training, you have to do hours of fmc dealer/starts training to be certified to sale cars. So not only did I spend a lot of time doing these test I only had 4 left to do when I came in today. So I was stopped by Ed and Lydia and they proceed to tell me I’m fired.. I’m very confused as to why cause I was not given a proper reason! So all day today I’ve been trying to get in touch with the general manager to ask why I have been fired, because Daniel was texting me asking me about the test, and how everything was going. Apparently Ford isn’t the right fit for me and I’m not a good candidate according to Lydia. I have 7 years of customer service and the job offers training so I’m not sure how that made sense. In my attempt to contact the General sales manager aka Daniel Flatt he has ignored me and now blocked my number. So I’m hoping this gets the dealerships attention. I was really counting on this job to help me pay my bills that are late (due to covid haven’t been able to find work) not only would it have helped paid my bills. This Ford Dealership has very poor management skills and I want to know why Daniel Didn’t come and talk to me or anything and why I spend countless hours and days working on test just to be fired.

text: I searched for a vehicle online.  I found an older vehicle with over 100K for what I felt I could get for a reasonable payment. The salesmen, Mr. Sparky Sparks and Mr. Bob Willard found out that for $15 cheaper per month I could purchase a brand new 2017 Ford Fiesta.  I was in dire straights for a vehicle as my other one was just totaled.  They were so compassionate towards my needs and felt like they honestly cared about my situation.  I cried in both happiness and relief.  Adamson Ford has a great sales team and I would recommend a purchase from there to all of my friends and family.

text: I decided to try this place due to it being so close to me. Then for the multi point inspection...I know they just press buttons. Boxes were not marked correctly. I have existing codes that have not been squared away and they marked it in good condition. If you know your car and just need a quick oil change this is a decent place...customer service was good and they completed the oil change, but if you don't know your car and need recommendations on what's really going on with your car...dont bother with this place. By the way...I am in the military and work on mechanics all day everyday so this review is legit!

name: Brittany Alexander
text:
We had a wonderful, stress free experience at Adamson Ford.  I highly recommend you visit there as well.  We saved thousands of dollars when compared to the other local dealership that uses a “no haggle” best price advertising campaign.

Our salesman, Justin Gray, was not only extremely knowledgeable about the details of the vehicle we were looking for and the various the trim packages, but also he essentially had the dealerships’ inventory committed to memory, so he was able to find us just what we needed in no time at all.

Justin didn’t employ any over the top sales tactics, and we never had to haggle.  Instead, he worked with us to find the right vehicle for us and went above and beyond to get us the best price possible (in reality,  not just in an advertisement). Justin was able to deliver on every request / concession we made.

The sales manager, David Galbraith,  was very polite and went out of his way to meet us.  He also went out of his way to get us more money for our trade-in. Refinancing folks and paperwork process was mind bogglingly fast.

You should definitely stop by and don’t be tricked by the claims of “no-haggle,” “best price” on the sticker type dealerships.

text: Phil Powell exceeded our car buying experience. He first listened to my needs and wants. This allowed him to know which direction and approach he needed totake. He was extremely patient with me as I decided on the “perfect” truck for me. After he showed me a few vehicles, I still wasn’t satisfied and I apologized. He assured me that his goal was to make me happy with my purchase. He was true to his word. They didn’t have the vehicle I wanted on their lot but he found one and they went and picked it up just for me, AMAZING!!! I would highly recommend Phil to anyone looking to purchase their next vehicle. Everyone that I interacted with at Adamson was beyond professional and polite. After visiting 2 previous dealerships, one of those my husband and I had purchased 2 vehicles from, didn’t even compare to the experience we had with Phil.  The experience, knowledge and level of customer service he provided was remarkable. Keep up the great work Phil!!!!

text: BUYER BEWARE!!! This review is for the service department. I tookk my truck in almost 2 weeks ago for a complete diagnostic.( On board computer - air conditioning etc) and was told that my car had no issues other than the air condition unit had a leak and my fan belt needing replacing. I allowed them to replace my fan belt and by the end of the day they told me my truck was no longer starting and then proceeded to tell me my engine computer was showing a bunch of error codes right after they told me everything was fine. They told me it was a timing chain which is extemely fishy considering they told me everything was fine. They supposedley had and engine guy look at the car all this week and I have yet to hear anything back from them further raising suspicison. They have made some many promises and have not fulfilled one to me. This is the worst car experince I have ever had. PLease dont use the service department.

resp.text: I am so sorry for your experience. I do understand that you brought this into our service department after purchasing somewhere else. Unfortunately sometimes with the age of the vehicle it can slow the diagnostic process and with no previous history of repairs this can take time. I will be sure and have someone contact you today with an update.

Awful service department.
Took my car here to get the recall issues dealt with. We called to make an appointment and they said no appointments necessary just go in be ask for Brad. Well we went online and made an appointment anyways to make sure. The appointment was made 2 weeks in advance,  I brought my car in for 9am (when they open) and was told to come back around closing business hours. I never got a single phone call all day which is fine. I call around 3 to see if it's done. Told I would be called back but no one did. Called twice more around 4:30 and was finally told they didn't have a chance to work on my car. Never would have known my car hadn't even been touched because no one bothered to call me to let me know what the status  was. No apologies or offer to get me a back up car to drive because they needed it the next day and couldn't guarantee they would have time to do it then either. Had I not called I wouldn't have had a car and they would have closed without telling me it was or wasn't done. Terrible customer service.

text: My wife and I spent a long time researching where we should buy our first car together. He was considerate, knowledgeable, a lot of fun. We were not the easiest customers, and our indecisiveness couldn't have been to deal with. Our Focus has been outstanding. text:
Their service department is usually pretty good. They're pretty inconsistent with their info tho. My first oil change I got it changed at the mileage the first guy told me to buy when I got my car back I got a whole lecture about how I waited too long and I I could have messed my car up. The guy was talking to me like I was incompetent I didn't appreciate that at all.

Today I went and scheduled some services and a skinny white lady with short hair and tattoos that works there backed into my car with someone else's car. If that doesn't make me not want to go back then I don't know what does. She didn't apologize or acknowledge the fact that she backed into my freaking car. My car is fine but after this service that I scheduled this might be it for me going to them.

Every other time they're fine tho I guess. But then again I've only been 3 times so, yea.

text: We wanted to test drive a used vehicle, when we show up we end up waiting 30 minutes and they put us in a new vehicle instead, not to mention the back door handle was broken, very embarrassing for them, I would hope. We were not pleased with this bait and switch. We took out business elsewhere.

resp.text: Mr. Harrison, I apologize on our behalf for your less than pleasant experience. Our aim is to provide an unparalleled buying process for our customers and I’m as disappointed as you are that we’ve missed our mark. I will use this as a training opportunity with all parties involved to prevent a future occurrence. I welcome your feedback and would love to have open dialogue with you about your experience in hopes to enhance yours and future customers’ experiences with Adamson Ford. Please contact me via email at rhoward@adamsonford.com or by phone at 205-271-4730 at your convenience. Regards, Robert Howard, General Sales Manager.

name: Chuck Thomason
text: Overall I have been pleased with Adamson Ford.  Considering I have purchased an Explorer, (2) EDGE Limited's, and most recently a 2014 F150 4X4 w/ Off Road Package from them.  Not to mention they handle all my service work.  It is with my F150 purchase were I am becoming more than frustrated and if not dealt with at this dealership will be moving any and all my business ASAP!  My F150 has 23K miles on it which are almost all highway miles.  Complained about the truck vibrating at speeds over 70 mph which has yet to be fixed or even addressed to my knowledge.  I also have a vibration when braking and was told my rotors need to be turned at a cost to me of about a 170 bucks.  Now I have owned many a car/truck and have never had to turn the rotors after only 23K miles of usage.  In fact, I don't think I have ever had to turn rotors on a car/truck I have purchased since I had a real job.  I am not sure if this dealership is willing to lose my business over 166 bucks, but I am damn sure willing to move it for that amount.  FORD - recognize you have an issue as this same complaint has been posted a number of times.

Terrible their after the sale service is horrid at best they hang up on you never return calls guve you other dead end numbers to call back at a later time worst exp.ive ever had I bought a barely used truck which had been on their lit over 30 days .When I returned home to Florida
After waiting 21 days I had not received the info to have my tag transferred now after months of wasted phone calls they tell me they don't have a title nor does the party whom they purchased from almost 5 months later and i have a new truck i still cant legally drive ...Ok I wanted to update this to let everyone know several months later and they rectified the situation and gave a very sincere apology for all the trouble.I was also able to get a tag finally .Also I want to say that my salseman Phillip was great my only issues at all here were the title thing and their front desk could be better the communication was the only other negative .

name: sjstrick0124 x
text: My daughter bought her first vehicle from Adamson Ford 3 months ago. She was sure to search for a car that had a carfax and found several she liked online. We live over 100 miles from Adamson Ford and probably could have bought a car a lot closer...but because of the online reviews...she chose Adamson. Well this week, she had to have her entire brake system replaced at the local Ford dealership. They told her that the underside of her car was completely rusted out. This happens when cars are from Northern regions where they use salt on the roads to melt ice....or beach towns where there is natural salt in the air. in places like THAT....it is standard practice for a mechanic to check the underside of a car. My daughter's car was a late model 2014. The vehicle was most likely purchased at auction and came from another area in the US outside of Alabama. She was not expecting to have to pay for  new brakes and other rusted out parts on the bottom of her car. She called Adamson Ford about it and they said it was not their problem. Typical! They are nice and polite BEFORE you buy from them....but if you have a problem they change mighty quick. This was my daughter's very first vehicle. She tried to ask all the right questions and STILL got burned. No help from THIS dealership! And worse...no acknowledgement that they did not check the bottom of the car before selling it to an unsuspecting 21 yr. old kid. Yeah...I am one angry parent! Shame on Adamson Ford. We will NEVER use you again. You COULD have helped with the cost a little. But once you made the deal...you abandoned your customer!

text: I just got home from buying a 2013 Ford Pickup from Adamson Ford and wanted to share some details of my experience with them. My first contact with Adamson Ford was on their internet site. The internet personnel were all very cordial and accommodating. They knew the answers to all my questions and answered them very quickly! When I decided exactly what I wanted I was invited to come in and sign the necessary forms to complete my purchase. When I arrived, I was greeted by the salesman and shown the vehicle. My salesman had the keys for the truck and I test drove it. Matt was my salesman. He answered all my questions and addressed all my concerns. The questions that he wasn’t sure about, he was able to get prompt answers for. Everyone that I spoke with at the dealership was extremely friendly and accommodating. I am impressed with Adamson’s sales team and will send them all the business that I can! They are great folks and I will surely be back to deal with them in the future!!!!

NOT ONLY did they deny my service when I went back for my scheduled truck oil change/ tire rotation, but other current employees (which are also friends of mine and very good people) were asked to not associate with me! I am FULLY aware ANY business has the right to deny someone their service, however Adamson Ford’s motto is #AlwaysAdamson #AlwaysFamily and I’m sure I wouldn’t be the first to tell you that it was NOT how I was treated that day due to these circumstances. I have been in the car business for years at 2 different dealerships and I encourage anyone that is in the market that wants to have a great experience in purchasing a like-new/used vehicle or needs quality service to PLEASE contact me.

After many frustrating experiences at Adamson, this was the final straw. I have been a customer of Adamson for years out of sheer connivence to my house. This past week I took my car to get my tires aired up and was told by my service advisor that I had a nail in it. They told me it was an easy patch and I was sent on my way. A day later I walked out to my car to head to work and my tire was completely flat! Turns out they just removed the nail and aired it up and sent me on my way. I came to a ford dealer expecting to receive a dealership experience but obviously customer service is not what this dealership prides themselves on. Only visit this dealership if you want half assed work and mediocre service.

text:
Filled out form on KBB to sell my Hummer H2. This was my first time using this option.

Once I put info based on my assessment of condition I submitted the form.

About 15 mins later I received a call from Mathew at Adamson Ford. This was the second call so the KBB system works.

Mathew asked me to give them a shot to see if they could meet or exceed the KBB offer that was sent to me.

I drive it to Adamson and meet Mathew 15 mins later they exceeded the KBB offer quote and I even negotiated a ride home. Cannot beat that for service.

text: Very courteous and professional.  There was no pressure and I got exactly what I wanted

name: Gina Reynolds
text:
My grandfather owned a dealership my whole life (I’m 30) up until 3 yrs ago when he sold it for retirement. My father managed the parts department there up until 2 years ago (because the new owners were crooks & he couldn’t stand to work with them any longer). Since, my sister bought a car from Adamson & was very happy with her experience. So in December, I decided I’d start getting my oil changes there. I work @ UAB so it was convenient around my work hrs. My 1st experience was great! The guy that took care of me made sure the guy that drives the shuttle got me to work by 7:30. I picked up my car & paid leaving as a happy customer. My 2nd experience wasn’t so great.
I decided I’d get my tires rotated as well. A different man took my order & I went inside to sign up for the shuttle service. That same man comes in & openly complains about how several people are out with the flu & says “this is just going to be a great day” in an annoyed, sarcastic tone. As I’m signing up for the shuttle, the guy that drives said, “shuttle rides don’t start until 8”. To that I responded, “The guy that was here last time made sure I was at UAB in time to clock in & you were the one that drove me”. He said, “that should be fine as long as a lot of people don’t sign up”, & then after asking if I should walk 15 minutes later, he finally drove me (10 minutes after asking). Mind you, I didn’t have that problem at all the 1st time. As I’m working I get a call from them saying “Ma’am when we were rotating your tires we noticed that they are in big need of changing. Can we put on new tires for you?” He didn’t expect me to not be naïve & mindlessly say yes (being a single young female). I asked, “How much would that be” & he said, “Oh uh…$1,600”. I said, ”Absolutely not!” & instead, took my car to a place in my hometown & got 4 top brand, brand new for $950.
Last week I decided to give them another shot thinking if that guy was there that served me the 1st time, it should be okay. I saw him, but was served by a man I hadn’t seen before. I ordered an oil change & tire rotation. I avoided the hassle of the shuttle & made the 15 min walk to work. I got a call from a female saying “when we were rotating your tires we noticed a nail in one of them & if we took it out the hole would be too big to patch, can we replace that tire?” I, of course, said no & to that she said, “okay well we can’t rotate your tires then”. I told her that was fine. But I thought the whole thing was strange because I hadn’t once received a “low tire pressure” warning. When I went to pick up my car I noticed on their write up they documented the nail. So I took my car to my parents so dad & his friend could look. NO NAIL! I tried calling the following day to speak with the manager, & the lady that I spoke with was rude, & on top of that, REFUSED to give me her name. Apparently, they don’t have a general manager, they just have a manager per department. I wanted to be fair thinking maybe the head guy didn’t know about his workers, but if it’s the manager of the parts department, they know, which is why I’m turning here. I don’t think it’s fair to try to screw people over to get more money, my grandfather didn’t run his business that way. & the best thing I can do is caution other people from going. At least to the parts department.

name: Tara Williams Rosser
text:
Thank you again, Antonio Glenn for going the extra mile to make sure that my experience at Adamson Ford ended on a good note. It's been a year since you sold me the Mustang I've been dreaming of since I was in the 5th grade, and you still dropped everything to help me today! When I get ready to buy my F-150 (can you tell I love Fords?!), I will definitely trust you with that purchase. In the meantime, I will be sure to tell all of my friends about the professionalism, honesty, and integrity that you display.

Thank you Cal Swann for taking the time to explain my service issue. Thank you for understanding that every customer has value and deserves to be treated with respect. When you sacrifice to purchase the vehicle, religiously bring it to the dealership for service, hand wash it and clean it inside and out every weekend, (and name it -shhh!) you worry about the "health" of your car. name: Steven Lane
text: Bought a 2016 Chrysler 300C from this dealership with less than 600 miles on it -- asked for a Carfax but was given an AutoCheck and was told that this was much more thorough than a Carfax -- this showed that the car had never been in an accident, etc. and was totally clean (the salesman, Bob Willard assured us of the same and said the vehicle would go through more than a 100 point inspection making sure that the car was in perfect condition.  After getting the vehicle home and detailing the car thoroughly, we noticed that the passenger door sounded hollow (like an empty garbage can).  We immediately took the vehicle to Myer's Auto Collision to have the car inspected --after inspecting it, he found the vehicle to have had over $4000 worth of damage (passenger back door had so much bondo it couldn't be read on his meter, passenger door was a hollow shell (aftermarket part - not factory), the hood had also been replaced with aftermarket part - not factory and wetsanded and painted with trash in paint.  We also ran a Carfax and found out that the vehicle had been wrecked and the airbag was deployed and vehicle was undriveable and had to be towed.  We went to Adamson and talked to the manager, Mike Gargone on 2 different occasions about this and was told he would not cancel the contract and also told us that the vehicle had not been wrecked.  He also said that the vehicle had been bought at Manheim Auction in Georgia and that they do not have to divulge the information of any wreck to a vehicle and that he did not know the vehicle had been wrecked (we have had reliable sources to tell us this is not true -- that if a vehicle is wrecked and airbags are deployed, it has to be divulged to the buyer).  It is hard to believe that a supposedly reputable dealership that is well known in the city of Birmingham would conduct business the way they have.  We feel we have been violated by fraud, lied to, and deceived.  How would they as experts in cars not know this vehicle had been wrecked and how are they not liable for not divulging that information to  us as a consumer? How can they get away with this?

name: Skyler Clark
text:
Updated
I wouldn't treat my dog the way they've treated me. I have bought 2 vehicles from them. David G. The sales guy, Hes great, but the problem came when I bought an 06 f-150 from them in November of 2015. I purchased an extended warranty through them and less than a week later I cancelled it (after I read the fine print). So I am entitled to a full refund. So the dealership sends off the forms to cancel the warranty while I do the same through email. I have to talk to David A in financing and he is the problem. He told me for a month that he hadn't heard from the warrenty company and I told him that I had and that they told me that they cancelled the warrenty. So he tells me to send the email stating that to him and so I do. Well then he says that I have to sign the form and him send it in and I reminded him I had the form so I sent him the original form I sent to Alpha warrenty. I finally tagged him in an email with Alpha Warrenty to get it all straighted out. Then Alpha calls me and asks who to send the email to, I Tell them David in financing and so they DO!!!! I call Adamsonford again and guess what? David in financing tells me that he got the email and is sending the check. Thats was December 14, 2015. So I call my finance company on Jan. 4, 2016 and they haven't received a payment. I email David in financing again and he says he's waiting on alpha from a fax he sent on December 14, 2015. I call the dealership and now someone else is "helping" who I won't disclose at this time. And he is waiting on a response from alpha warrenty. ...... really??? I've BOUGHT 2 VEHICLES FROM THIS PLACE AND WAS GOING TO AGAIN..... all I can say is things better go right or I will discourage everyone on every page and website, social media and whatever else I can. If a customer calls with a problem you don't just email or call the place then leave it, you keep calling or emailing until it's fixed especially when I buy more than once......
After submitting this review I had a lady contact me named Melissa. She looked into the problem and found that they never sent the money for the warrenty. She has been a pleasure to work with and I wish I would have done this sooner. Sadly I won't be buying another vehicle from them as long as David A. In financing or Shaun(syan) works there as their apathy and laziness is appalling. Everthing is sunshine and rainbows until u have a problem.Everyone else at adamsonford is great, but if the finance guy who pushes a warrenty doesn't send the money, what else are they not doing?

name: Ray Askins
text: I got my ok on loan from USAA for vets, they are under Car truth , they ask for make and model. once you type that, it list the dealers that have agreed to be honest on cost with them and to sell it for a decent price.i had 4 Ford dealers, my car appeared 100 miles off so I took the agreed price to Adamson.. I was looking for a Ford Fusion, Chevy Impala, or Acura or Subaru. I wanted a great quiet,  ride but I wanted the new safety features. I was surprised when I looked at the Ford Fusion Titanium. It will parallel park for you, just settle into spot on its own, has back up camera with warning sounds go green ,yellow, and red when back gets closer , it will slow with cruise on its own slower than setting to keep from hitting car in front, it has blind spot detectors on both sides of car that light up in outside mirror, then vibrate steering to keep you from coming over on car in blind spot. I actually tested this stuff. it is super quiet and smooth as silk. i still am amazed at the remarkable job Ford did with the Fusion Titanium , It is Metallic Red Bronze, with leather heat and air-conditioned seats. best car I've seen and now own, Take my advice, drive a 2016 Ford Fusion Titanium , and if you were looking for THE CAR, you will buy it. BobWillard and Shaun Yan helped me and there are no nicer folks to deal with.

name: Tony C
text:
This dealership fraudulently ran my credit without even speaking to me whatsoever. Had a female employee call me and tell me that i was approved for credit acting like she was from ford motor credit, then a man named Phil called telling me i was approved also and not a pre approval an actual approval , then basically says the he couldn't get ahold of my boss so i couldn't get credit , So they basically got my licence and check stubs and credit report under false pretences pretending to be from Ford Motor Credit , They are absolutely nuts messing with peoples lives live they are nothing, ive never been so humiliated by a car dealership in my life and they should face some sort of consequences
I even asked my boss if they called and he said no , so in so many words Phil didn't try to verify my employment, and Phil says he looked the business i work for in the phone book, does he not know there are lots of other ways to have a business phone and the business i work for just started a few months ago so it wouldn't be in a phonebook , He may want to talk to the customer before he dismisses a customer that hes made a fool of, Phil doesnt know how To do his job very well obviously and some woman named Alauna does his dirty work too, they should both be ashamed for what they did.

name: Brittney B
text: Norris went over and beyond to help me get the car of my dreams. For once I didnt feel used or misled. Thanks for everything Adamson Ford.

name: Meeka Acklin
text: My experience with them keep gets worse & worse. On March 25, 2016 I was at malfunction junction when my 2007 Mustang just stopped working. I pull over & immediately use my road side assistance then google the nearest Ford dealership because I was fairly new to the area. I called the service department & not sure who I spoke with but he was friendly & I told him I would be having my car towed to them for diagnostic work within the hour. He said ok bring it in. Ok me & my boyfriend  follow the tow truck there & speak with Jay in service. He assured me that would try to figure it out. After sitting there for 30min, he comes to the break room & said it was my battery. I said ok replace it. Did that & it still would not crank up. So him & another gentleman almost tore up the starter by trying to crank it & I literally had to say PLEASE stop doing that. So it was around 3 on a friday so Jay stated that the head tech was out & leave my car for the weekend & Monday he will call me by 10am & let me know whats the problem. I said ok. Well Monday I called in to work so I could be available about my car. I called him at 1030 am because I hadnt heard from him. He said they still working on it & try back at 12. Called at 1230pm & he replied they cant get my car crunk up so they dont know whats wrong. That they will start from the bottom up to find the problem.I said I need to know the problem because thats my way to work. He said as long as it doesnt crank up they cant find out. My dad is a retired mechanic so I ask why is that because most car issues often doesnt allow the car to crank up. He said they know its misfiring but dont know from where. I said the diagnostic machine should tell you. I was informed then they dont have a diagnostic machine to put my car own. I about passed out. I said well how long will this take because I need a car to get to work & I need to know what to do. Jay told me that I may need to call enterprise because they dont give out loaner cars & cant fix it until they figure out whats wrong. I said my dad & brother fix on cars & I have never heard of a Ford dealership not able to tell me what was wrong with a Ford car. Jay reply was why dont you get them to look at it. I was just angry. So I called my dad & brother out of town & they instructed me to get to a local Pep boys to get diagnostic testing. Informed Jay of this on that Monday that a tow truck would be to get my car that Tuesday morning. Jay informed my road side assistance that I owed them no money but I didnt want to use them because I didnt want to pay them. By now I was livid. My boyfriend was too. So the following day the tow truck driver went there 2 times to get my car for them to not be able to get my car because it wasnt accesible. I called them & informed them if they dont have my car accesible a 3rd time I was coming with the police. 3rd time tow truck was able to get my car.  Took it to Pep boys & they had a diagnosis within 2hrs. Well in May I left the same review on their facebook page & whoever is over it apologized & offered me 2 free oil changes. Well I have tried to get these 2 free oil changes for me to get there at 2pm on June 28th for Jay to yell out they done with oil changes for the day. So the gentleman at the desk asked could I come back the next day. I said I work all day. He said can you drop it off at lunch. I said sure. I called the next day at lunch to say can you bring it at 2pm. I said no. Tried to bring it again then no time. Its sad that you offer me something for bad service to get bad service on the free offer as well.

text: I was ripped off royally. I needed a fuel filter change; that's it. A couple of hours later, I received a telephone call that my vehicle required new spark plugs, cooling system flush, and some other items: $800. I am new to the area and I did drive my 2003 Mountaineer from PA to Alabama, so I gave the guy the benefit of the doubt. When I picked up my vehicle, I was told that I needed a new serpentine belt--which I had replaced three days earlier at Oil Express (which are great, by the way). I was also told that my rear tire required new ball bearings at a cost of another $800; if the "rods and spindles" were damaged, that would cost another $800 ($1600/total). I declined. I went to Phelco Automotive and the same repair cost $400; the mechanic saw no damage or corrosion to the spindles and rods, and had no idea why Adamson wanted to replace them. AVOID THIS PLACE YOU WILL BE RIPPED OFF!!!!!!!!
